title: Can anyone help identify these two sans-serif fonts from my University's shop logo?
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063321im_/http:/typophile.com/files/identify_6647.jpg)

The top looks like it could be Nimbus Sans, but I feel like it is a little wider, unless it is stretched.

The bottom looks almost identical to Helvetica Neue UltraLight but it appears to be a different font-weight...too thin to be Light and too thick to be Ultralight? :s Maybe it's stroked?

Font: 

 Helvetica Neue 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063321/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")
author: stillnotdavid

comments.content: To me and as all you said, that all looks like [Helvetica Neue](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317063321/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/neue-helvetica), Black and Thin.
Thank you...I feel really dumb now lol
